subject: RE: [junit] JUnit and Ant: stack trace filtering
msgSnippet: ... More to the point, what other information would be possible? The TestCase is the lowest level of granularity supported by JUnit. It s the actual test
messageBody:
Stefan Bodewig wrote:
> On Thu, 06 Dec 2001, Mark Derricutt <mark@...> wrote:
>
> > I've just started using it, and one of my tests failed (I knew it
> > would). But, Ant never told me which test failed, it said which
> > TestCase failed, but not the actual test.
>
> What are you expecting it to do? Which kind of output would you want
> it to generate?

More to the point, what other information would be possible?

The TestCase is the lowest level of granularity supported by JUnit. It's the
actual test method that will be invoked. It either succeeds or it fails.

If you need further detail of _where_ in a TestCase JUnit has failed, that's
what:
a) the stacktrace; and
b) the optional message argument to the various assert() methods

provides for you.

Robert.
